title: Twitter Stock Is Tanking After Software Glitch Hits Earnings
text:
Twitter (TWTR) stock is down sharply Thursday after the company posted weaker-than-expected third quarter revenue and profit growth, despite surprisingly strong user growth. Fourth quarter guidance also fell shy of expectations.

For the third quarter, Twitter reported revenue of $824 million, up 9% year-over-year, at the bottom end of the company’s forecast range of $815 million to $875 million, and below the consensus forecast from Wall Street analysts of $874 million. description: Twitter stock was down sharply Thursday after the company posted weaker-than-expected third quarter revenue and profit growth, despite surprisingly strong user growth. Twitter blamed “revenue product issues.”
